instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 no power/ orange light
threads.message:
This Mac has been in contact with liquid, a region where the u8005 component and resistors are, which has undergone major oxidation.  Replaces oxidized components, but I have no success. 
   
Voltage:

   3_S5 / SUS = 3.34v
  S5_PWRGD = 3.4V
  PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.43V
  PCH_DSWVRMEN = 3.07V
  SMC_ONOFF_L = 3.23V
  PM_RSMRST_L = 3.33V
  PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.43V

  PCH_INTRUDER_L 2.05V
  PCH_INTVRMEN 0.08V
  PPBUS_g3h 12.59V
  All_SYS 0v
  RTC_REST_L 0.08V
  SMC_ONOFF 3.39
  PM_SLP_SUS_L 0V, with pulse.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power/ orange light
threads.message:
"PCH_INTVRMEN 0.08V
--------
RTC_REST_L 0.08V"
Start fixing these.
Unfortunatelly, you didn't mention PCH_SRTCRST_L; could be bad too.

I bet for corrosion under PCH, as PCH_INTRUDER_L is also lower than expected.
Replace first R1302/03; may need to replace C1303 too.
If still low, heat PCH area with quality flux.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power/ orange light
threads.message:
Please, leave feedback about solution.
You are probably happy finding solutions in other posts.
Why do not help you too???
